messages.content:
As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: LOS ANGELES POLICE DEPARTMENT
CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION DIVISION
Narcotics Enforcement Section
SIGNAL: 85N
ITEM NUMBER: N-85068-27
PAGE 28 of 68
CASE SUPERVISORS:
Lt. Katherine Morris
Sgt. David Parker
CASE INVESTIGATOR:
Det. Steven Hill
ASSISTING DETECTIVES:
Sgt. Michelle Rodriguez
Sgt. Andrew Lopez
( Drug Task Force)
Det. Elizabeth Davis
Det. Christopher Young
( Drug Task Force)
Det. Jessica Lee
( Drug Task Force)
Det. Brian Foster
Det. Sarah Mitchell
(General Assignment)
Det. Alex Johnson
(Street Gang Unit)
Det. Emily Thompson
(Organized Crime Division)
VICTIM:
JANE DOE, female, local resident.
DATE, TIME, and
LOCATION of OFFENSE:
18 JANUARY 2028 at approximately 9:30 PM in the Venice area.
REPORTING OFFICER:
BADGE:
Det. Steven Hill
4821
The investigation navigated through a web of underground networks and anonymous tips. Officer Gonzalez, on surveillance duty in Venice, was the first to report suspicious drug-related activities. Assisting her were Sgt. Michelle Rodriguez and Patrol Officer Martinez, who swiftly coordinated a containment strategy. Technician Smith, an expert in narcotic analysis, was assigned to examine the seized substances. Criminalist Edwards, delving into the forensic evidence, discovered distinct drug signatures that were key in identifying the suppliers. Coroner Dr. Johnson was later involved to examine a victim found in a related overdose case, yielding critical insights into the narcotic operation. Patrol Officer Thompson, collaborating with local informants, uncovered connections that led to a major drug bust.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lt. Katherine Morris Officer Context: Supervised the case in the Narcotics Enforcement Section. Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Sgt. David Parker Officer Context: Co-supervisor of the case with Lt. Morris. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Steven Hill Officer Context: Lead investigator of the narcotics case, reporting officer. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Sgt. Michelle Rodriguez Officer Context: Assisted in coordinating containment, part of the Drug Task Force. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sgt. Andrew Lopez Officer Context: Drug Task Force sergeant, supported the operation. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Elizabeth Davis Officer Context: Drug Task Force detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Christopher Young Officer Context: Involved in the case, from the Drug Task Force. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Jessica Lee Officer Context: Drug Task Force detective, assisted in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Brian Foster Officer Context: General assignment detective, part of the investigative team. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Sarah Mitchell Officer Context: General Assignment detective, assisted in the narcotics case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Alex Johnson Officer Context: Street Gang Unit detective, involved in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Emily Thompson Officer Context: Organized Crime Division detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Officer Gonzalez Officer Context: First to report drug-related activities in Venice. Officer Role: Patrolling Officer Officer Name: Patrol Officer Martinez Officer Context: Assisted in executing a containment strategy. Officer Role: Patrol Officer Officer Name: Technician Smith Officer Context: Narcotic analysis expert, assigned to examine seized substances. Officer Role: Forensic Technician Officer Name: Criminalist Edwards Officer Context: Analyzed forensic evidence, discovered distinct drug signatures. Officer Role: Criminalist Officer Name: Coroner Dr. Johnson Officer Context: Examined a victim in a related overdose case, provided insights into the narcotic operation. Officer Role: Medical Examiner Officer Name: Patrol Officer Thompson Officer Context: Worked with informants, uncovered connections leading to a drug bust. Officer Role: Community Relations Officer
